items.title: Senior Business Developer (Status Open Bounty)
items.content:
Status

Status is building powerful decentralized apps on Ethereum that change the way we do things on the web. Our rapidly growing team is made up of self-motivated individuals who prosper in a fast-paced environment and value the ability to work from anywhere.

Opportunity

Open Bounty is one of Status’ flagship products that aims to foster the movement for open source software.

Open source software is a multi-billion dollar industry, but historically has lacked the right incentive structures to reward developers for their efforts. Using blockchain technology and the power of smart contracts on Ethereum, Status Open Bounty enables developers to be rewarded in cryptocurrency for code contributions, and organisations to post bounties and find talented new team members.

Job role

We are looking for a Senior Business Developer to structure, develop and support our partnership activities for Status Open Bounty.

Your main duties include identifying and developing strategies to deliver more value to this product, identify partnership opportunities and lead all aspects of execution.

Responsibilities

  • Proactively push thinking around product partnerships and other strategic initiatives
  • Closes new business deals by coordinating requirements, developing and negotiating contracts
  • Responsible for achieving strategic account targets
  • Communicate with major partners on a regular basis and respond to specific queries
  • Assist in financial planning and analysis.
  • Integrating contract requirements with business operations.
  • Conduct research to identify new markets and customer needs

Requirements

  • 5+ years minimum work experience with sales or business development
  • Successful track record selling new business and products in emerging technology markets  
  • Ability to execute many tasks in parallel across multiple threads involving numerous stakeholders and counterparties
  • Technical savvy enabling you to easily interact with software developers and architects.
  • Ability to qualify leads and counterparties rigorously
  • Commitment to structured negotiations and outcomes
  • Excellent written and verbal English and communication skills
  • Ability to travel 25-50+% required depending on your location.
  • Self-motivated and the ability to work with a high degree of autonomy.

Working at Status

We're a remote team of made up of 40 people scattered around the globe. Everyone at Status works from a location of their choosing - and we all meet up twice a year to strategize and strengthen our relationships.

We care deeply about open source software, and our organizational structure does away with strict hierarchy and fixed work hours. We believe in working with a high degree of autonomy while supporting the team's priorities.

items.title: Enterprise Sales - UK
items.content:
Enterprise Sales - UK at Talmundo

London, London, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Communication Skills, Enterprise Sales, Native English Speaker, Fluent in English, Proactive attitude
Compensation
£45K–£55K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

As an Onboarding Solutions Consultant you’ll be responsible for driving sales of Talmundo products within Enterprise prospects located in The UK exceeding sales objectives. You will manage all aspects of the sales process including lead management, qualification, evaluation, close and support the customer success department when needed. This role is a quota-carrying sales position that plays an integral role in the success of the overall sales team.

The benefits of joining our team:

• Location: London, working remotely. With frequent visits to our main offices in Antwerp office and/or The Hague, which are both centrally located near the central train stations.
• Flexibility: We value balance and time with your family (however you define it). You can combine working from home, at our offices and working from client offices. We don’t focus on the number of hours but believe in trust and results.
• Opportunity: You'll work for one the most exciting start-ups in the Benelux region, now employing 20 people and working with some of the biggest brands and companies like Bacardi, Deloitte, ArcelorMittal, BNP, etc.
• Team: Join a young, dynamic and fast growing international team.
• Offer: We offer a competitive package with both short and long term incentives.

Some of the things you’ll be doing include:
• Define and execute territory / account sales plans for assigned geographic territory and then meet and exceed sales goals (quotas) through prospecting, qualifying, managing and closing sales opportunities.
• Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect and assess sales and move a large number of transactions simultaneously through the sales pipeline.
• Manage and track customer and transactional information in a CRM system.
• Coordinate resources throughout the sales cycle, including product support and sales engineering.
• Provide product demonstrations and general support to prospective customers.
• Provide regular reporting of pipeline and forecast through the CRM system.
• Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products.
• Practice effective, excellent communication with management, prospects and support staff.
• Participate in team building and company-growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts and customer care.
• Travel to customer locations.
• Other duties as assigned.

Who you are:
• Experienced. 2 – 5 years of enterprise software sales experience.
• Multilingual. English native. Other languages will be a plus.
• Domain. Affinity with HR software solutions is preferred although not a must.
• Performer. Consistent overachievement of sales goals in a defined geographic territory.
• Eager to learn. You have a desire, even an obsession, to keep learning and develop new skills.
• Proactive. You don’t wait for things to happen, you make then happen.
• Consultant. Ability to quickly build trust with prospects using consultative selling approach.
• Challenger. Able to question current scenarios with facts and figures.
• Team player. Able to work independently but perfectly integrated into a team.
• Excellent Communication. You know what to say and more importantly, how to say it.
• Go-Getter. Willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful.

Does this sound like a role for you? Send us your CV to jobs@talmundo.com.

items.title: Business Development (Full Time, Remote)
items.content:
This is a remote position.

Summary

We are looking for a motivated and high-achieving individual based in Europe to join the team working on expansion of the company in global markets. This is a full time placement with significant opportunities for growth, travel and advancement as one of the first employees of the company.

The Company

causaLens is high-tech startup based in London. We are bringing machine learning and big data technologies to the World’s leading asset managers. We are an extraordinary team and the founders have worked for some of the most prominent global hedge funds and scientific institutions.

Core requirements

* Highly capable, self-motivated, collaborative and personable
* Strong academic record
* Strong commercial skills gained from a professional background
* Interest in advanced technologies such as machine learning
* Able to demonstrate integrity, drive and natural curiosity
* An excellent written and verbal communicator with a high level of business acumen
* Ability to effectively work remotely (from home or coworking space)

Roles and Responsibilities

The role is varied and involves a combination of strategic & critical thinking, analysis and engagement with internal and external stakeholders.
* You will identify new opportunities and manage the full sales cycle from finding new prospects through to closure.
* You will be developing and maintaining value-based relationships with our customers.
* You will work directly with the CEO on developing and evaluating new opportunities.

Benefits

Successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a fast-growing, agile, and international team passionate about innovation and making a difference. We will offer guidance, mentorship, and opportunities for professional development.

items.title: Senior Account Strategist
items.content:
Senior Account Strategist - Jobmote

Senior Account Strategist

Yoko Co

Yoko Co is looking for an Senior Account Strategist - Someone to collaborate closely with clients and team members in the development and execution of a web presence strategy (mostly website design and development projects) that delivers tangible results.

In this role, you will work closely with clients who actually make a difference in the world, and it's our goal for you to have work that you thoroughly enjoy (most of the time), that challenges you to grow (much of the time), and which ultimately makes you proud (all of the time).

This position isn't for everyone. In fact, it's not for most people. It requires a combination of experience, knowledge, interpersonal skills, and creative problem solving that is found in less than 2.8% of the population.

If you think you've got what it takes, read on.

As an ideal candidate, you should:

  • Be comfortable working directly with clients, managing expectations, and explaining complex issues at whatever level of technical understanding they may have and championing their mission and passion for our team.
  • Be able to manage and maintain client relationships, coordinating with the team to ensure efforts are aligned with their objectives, and that calls and meetings are an upbeat and positive experience.
  • Understand the principles of marketing that gets results. This includes understanding the buyers journey, conversion orientation, calls to action, landing pages, autoresponders, drip email campaigns, squeeze pages, redemption pages and more.
  • Understand content marketing, search engine optimization, conversion rate optimization, marketing automation, and the slew of related and affiliated elements that affect these practices. (Experience with platforms like WordPress, Hubspot, Mailchimp, Google Analytics, etc. is great.)
  • Be well versed in traditional marketing communications skills including but not limited to copywriting, blogging, public relations, basic graphic design, web design best practices,
  • Understand the role these elements – and the website as a whole – relate to each client's organizational objectives and goals.
  • Follow a well-documented process and contribute to our agency's growth by updating it to make it more effective.
  • Be able to manage an internal team, collaborating and dictating strategy and aiding with tactical execution.
  • Be able to wear many hats, and change them quickly. In a single day, you may lead a client call to create strategy, sketch out a landing page, draft emails to clients, collaborate on a home page design, provide feedback on a client video or animation, collaborate with your team to draft new content and CTA ideas for approval, present a proposal, and then grab lunch.
  • Ideally have experience working in a similar position in an ad agency or web design firm. Alternatively have experience serving in a similar capacity virtually or on your own as an entrepreneur or contractor.
  • Be self-motivated and take initiative. If you're the kind of person who waits for someone to tell you what to do, this isn't your kind of place.
  • Be a problem solver, both collaboratively and on your own. Your Google-fu must be strong.
  • Be well-spoken and be able to take command of a room, call, or conversation.
  • Have a map to the fabled, but likely cursed, Montezuma’s Treasure.
  • Have a "can-do attitude" and be willing to jump in and try something new to expand your skills and contribute to our greater good.
  • Be willing to give and receive feedback responsibly, have the perspective to evaluate it, and the flexibility to make adjustments.
  • Be an avid learner. Half the fun of this job is learning what goes on behind the scenes in new client industries and keeping up with a constantly shifting market and our own quick paced rapidly evolving industry. You should be excited to share knowledge by educating and receiving education from others both team members and clients.
  • Be passionate about your work. As an agency we know the impact we have on the world is through the way we amplify our clients' impact. For that reason we work only with people with whom we're well aligned. That goes for clients and employees.

In this role, you'll be encouraged to contribute to and shape a company as it grows in a way you'd never have the opportunity to within a larger firm.

Still intrigued?

Good! In exchange for these skills you'll be rewarded with a very flexible work schedule, medical benefits, the option to telecommute as you'd like, great pay, unlimited leave, as well as participation in our annual shutdown (two, sometimes more, weeks off at the end of the year) and most federal holidays. Perhaps more importantly you'll find yourself immersed in work that actually matters.

P.S. - It's worth mentioning that if you join us, you'll participate in our pursuit to positively impact the lives of 100,000,000 people by the end of 2020. It's no small task, but we're already at over 27,000,000 and with someone like you on the team? Our odds just got better.

P.S. - It's worth mentioning that if you join us, you'll participate in our pursuit to positively impact the lives of 100,000,000 people by the end of 2020. It's no small task, but we're already at over 27,000,000 and with someone like you on the team? Our odds just got better.

Apply for this position

  • Ability to execute many tasks in parallel across multiple threads involving numerous stakeholders and counterparties
  • Technical savvy enabling you to easily interact with software developers and architects.
  • Ability to qualify leads and counterparties rigorously
  • Commitment to structured negotiations and outcomes
  • Excellent written and verbal English and communication skills
  • Ability to travel 25-50+% required depending on your location.
  • Self-motivated and the ability to work with a high degree of autonomy.

    Working at Status

    We're a remote team of made up of 40 people scattered around the globe. Everyone at Status works from a location of their choosing - and we all meet up twice a year to strategize and strengthen our relationships.

    We care deeply about open source software, and our organizational structure does away with strict hierarchy and fixed work hours. We believe in working with a high degree of autonomy while supporting the team's priorities.

items.title: PR Account Executive
items.content:
About Prezzroom:

Prezzroom, a public relations company for startups with clients in London and New York, is seeking a public relations Account Executive -- a mid-level to senior-level role -- for immediate hire.

Prezzroom is made for startups, by startups. We're on a mission to challenge the PR industry and bring quality, yet affordable PR services to small businesses. Focusing on Health and Wellness, one of the world's fastest-growing markets, we discover today’s newest and most innovative companies and make sure they get the exposure their brand deserves.

Our global roster of clients includes several of the fastest growing brands in wellness, covering fitness events and studios, food and drink, as well as new consumer technology across health, beauty and fashion. We are seeking an ambitious, entrepreneurial, professional, and enthusiastic self-starter interested in rapidly advancing their career in public relations while helping some of the newest, most extraordinary companies take off. All candidates must have at least two years post-university experience either at a public relations agency or in-house.

Duties:

Executing PR campaigns as an integral member of a team
Drafting, editing, and reviewing press materials
Dealing with enquiries from press, clients, new business and external organizations
Issuing press releases and pitching to reporters both within the UK and internationally
Daily media monitoring
On a regular basis, conducting direct client engagement
Undertaking industry research and generating story ideas and angles
Developing and maintain relationships with media to secure and grow coverage
Supporting in-person and phone meetings with clients and potential new business
Supporting and training your own personal Intern

Skills Requirement:

Minimum of 2 years PR agency experience post-university
Exceptional written and verbal communication
Excellent knowledge of the health and wellness or food and drink industry
Demonstrated ability to think strategically and to identify opportunities for clients
Ability to communicate clearly and transfer complex information in a concise and clear form
Ability to prioritize and plan effectively
Strong attention to detail
Ability to work well in a startup team
Excellent interpersonal skills
Motivated to excel in a fast-paced environment
Ability to maintain a high level of social, organizational and professional standards in job-related activities

Candidates must submit a resume and cover letter.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Location:
London, UK
Flexible hours
Ability to work remotely

Required education:
Bachelor's

Required experience:
post-university: 2 years

Required language:
English

items.title: Business Development Consultant - Broadstairs, Kent
items.content:
YoSoft UK is a new Online Media business specialising in video production, website development, social media management and IT Support. Our aim is to provide high quality, fast connectivity services at an affordable price for SME’s. Our team operate remotely from home, keep in touch via Skype and are on the ground to see customers when necessary.


Opportunity
We are looking for somebody to drive growth directly in the B2B channels. Our prices are incredibly competitive without any sacrifice to quality, experiance and customer service.

We are completely open minded when it comes to this opportunity – but are looking for somebody who is passionate about sales and loves what they do.

If you are interested in earning a bit of extra cash on the side, growing your sales network, or want the opportunity to become part of a growing company in a competitive space.

What will you need to do?

You find leads for YoSoft UK acting on our behalf, we will provide you with the necessary toolkit and resources to help you get started. We will assist you all the way through to closure of the sale where necessary.

Key Attributes

- 1-2 years B2B Sales experience/Partnership experience,

- Self-motivated, passionate individual,

- High level of organisational skills,

- Ability to listen, question and react to customer needs,

- Excellent written and verbal English,

- Understanding of Video Production, Website Development and Social Media Management is a bonus


What we offer?

This is a freelance commission based position to begin with, successful persons will be offered permanent contract. Highly lucrative commission for each sign-up on-going throughout the agreement.

Future plans?

We are aiming to have an office in Broadstairs, Kent towards the end of 2018. This opportunity is a side project/part-time opportunity for somebody who will ideally grow into a permanent role.

items.title: Sales Account Executive @ Retail Zipline
items.content:
Sales Account Executive @ Retail Zipline

2017-11-24 20:56

Description

Are you passionate about helping retail companies revolutionize the way they do business? Are you looking for a sales career that allows you to close deals with the world’s best known brands and Fortune 1,000 leaders?

Our mission is to bring retail operations out of the dark ages and give companies effective tools that their employees love to use. You will improve the way that this 4.4 trillion dollar industry communicates with its store employees and save them from sad, slow, inefficient systems (think fax machines, voicemails and the postal service). People deserve better! We need your help to make this happen.

We are an early stage, well-funded company. We have awesome investors, great customers and are looking for a Enterprise Sales Account Executive to help us accelerate our growth and shape the company’s future. Our customers include Gap Inc, TOMS shoes, and Levis. Our average deal size is in the six figures. Only seeking self-starters that are independent thinkers and an extrovert who loves building and developing relationships with others. Your work will help accelerate the sales process as well as help us meet our customer acquisition and revenue targets. We need someone with experience selling SaaS software to businesses (retail industry a plus) that can manage the full sales cycle from generating leads, to presenting to senior leaders, to closing deals (although don’t worry, you will have lead gen support).

Responsibilities:

  • Maximize and close inbound/outbound leads, reignite lost leads and grow new revenue from businesses of all sizes.
  • Run and manage a full-cycle sales process including building awareness, generating leads, demoing the product, ensuring follow up, presenting to retailers, getting cross-functional buy-in and closing deals.
  • Understand each retail company’s internal culture, politics, and organizational structure to best influence decision making and lay the foundation for strong, long-lasting relationships (ideally within Store Operations, but not necessary).
  • Ensure customer success through advising on best practices, participating in onboarding, and expanding use of Zipline within an account.
  • Help build the structure, tools, and processes needed to scale sales and support repeatable growth.
  • Manage, track, and report sales activities and results with Salesforce.
  • Be the voice of the customer to the product team.
  • Help inform and develop marketing and sales collateral.
  • Understand retail market shifts and trends while being aware of new products and potential competition.

A little bit more about you:

  • 4+ years in SaaS B2B sales, ideally with retail as a vertical.
  • A firm mastery of sales and negotiation approaches, including consultative, problem solving, and issue resolution skills.
  • You can effectively communicate to, present to, influence or befriend all levels within an organization.
  • A strong track record for managing the full sales process from prospecting leads to closing sales.
  • Outstanding listening and writing skills. A keen ability to translate complex concepts into simple and intuitive communication.
  • Team player with excellent collaboration skills to build relationships across the company -- both ours as well as our customers.
  • A desire to hunt for new business and close deals and willingness to travel.

What's In It for You

  • A competitive salary and commission plan
  • Equity
  • Medical and Dental benefits
  • A flexible vacation policy and work environment
  • A distributed team in SF and Vancouver
  • Career growth and being involved in the growth and culture of a company from the start
  • Fantastic co-workers

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Inside Sales Executive @ Teamup
items.content:
Inside Sales Executive @ Teamup

2017-11-24 17:28

Description

ABOUT US!

Teamup is an all-in-one business management solution for independent fitness businesses. Our customers include businesses like CrossFit gyms, yoga studios, martial arts centres, and more.

Since 2012, teamup has helped thousands of businesses take control of payments, scheduling, and member management.

Our remote team of 10 is currently based in the UK, US, and Spain.

THE JOB

  • Qualifying potential customers
  • Handling incoming enquiries
  • Managing the sales pipeline
  • Following up consistently
  • Using data to identify opportunities (we’ll show you how)
  • Phone and email communication with customers and prospects

YOU HAVE

  • Native-level English proficiency and are excited to work directly with customers via email, phone or screen share
  • Ability to engage potential customers by phone, and understand their requirements.
  • Determination for every customer to have a great experience with teamup and a desire to take responsibility for the customers you are helping
  • Experience working in a remote environment (comfortable primarily communicating over platforms like Close.io, Hipchat, Skype, Basecamp, ZenDesk, Jira etc.)
  • Computer literacy

The schedule to work Monday through Friday, 9am - 5:30pm UK time, with ability to cover some hours during evenings, weekends and on public holidays if required

ESSENTIAL TO HAVE (bonus points for both)

  • Experience of fitness businesses
  • Experience working in the software industry

WHY WORK FOR US?

We’re a very small team doing very big things — your work will make a huge impact and your voice will be heard! We offer a competitive salary, gym membership, team meet ups and a great team atmosphere to help you achieve your best work.

  • Salary
  • £21,000 per annum

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Applicants should be based in Europe

items.title: Sales Engineer @ Event Espresso / Event Smart
items.content:
Sales Engineer @ Event Espresso / Event Smart

2017-11-24 16:37

Description

Event organizers all over the world trust Event Espresso to organize a variety of events including workshops, seminars, conferences, training classes, golf tournaments, courses and more. As a member of the sales team, you’ll have an impact in helping customers understand how our events solution can help them be successful with their events.

An overview of a typical day

Here is what your day might look like:

  • Help customers understand how Event Espresso will benefit them
  • Plan and execute your new sales experiments; share your findings with the team
  • Collaborate with the team on new product planning

Requirements

Experience. You must have the following experience:

  • Installing, using and troubleshooting WordPress, themes, and plugins
  • Understanding basic HTML, CSS, and maybe some PHP
  • Ability to take the initiative and drive business
  • Strong communicator. You’ll collaborate with our team and customers on a daily basis, so excellent written and communication skills are required.

Remote work is natural to you. You have familiarity with working remotely such as from a home office or a co-working center with reliable equipment.

Ability to prioritize and take action. You have a willingness to create a plan and default to action. And if you run into some issues with your plan, you’ll ask for help, adjust your path, and move forward again.

Reliable. At Event Espresso, you’ll have a lot of autonomy such as choosing where, when, and how you work. You must deliver.

Curious. You are inquisitive and ask questions as a way to learn and get better at your craft.

Preferred Skills

These are nice-to-haves but are not required.

  • Familiarity with Google Analytics
  • Experience with a help desk tool including but not limited to Zendesk, Groove, or Help Scout
  • Comfortable with writing content such as team instructions, operating procedures, and blog posts

Trial to Hire

A paid trial will help you understand what it is like to work at Event Espresso. During this time, you’ll have a small project that you’ll work on in addition to daily tasks such as following up with customers that are interested in our events solution. A trial period will help you understand what is expected of the role. Each week, you’ll have a check-in with a team member who will coach you to find your strengths and answer any questions that you may have.

The time commitment for a paid trial is flexible at part-time or full-time and lasts about one month.

This is a contract position. Compensation is based upon experience and performance.

Country

Anywhere

Pressable, a leading provider of WordPress hosting, is looking for a seasoned sales leader to build a high-performance sales and account management team.

items.title: Sales Engineer
items.content:
Sales Engineer - Jobmote

Sales Engineer

iMerit Technology Services

About iMerit

iMerit is a unique for-profit company with a social impact mission. We specialize in providing data services to global clients. Founded by successful entrepreneurs in Silicon Valley, we employ marginalized youth and women who have been trained in digital skills. This workforce provides critical services such as data enrichment, sentiment analysis, and data classification.

Our customers range from large, enterprise organizations to high-impact tech and e-commerce companies. We work with their most innovative teams in Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Product Experience and Data Science.

Our funders include Omidyar Network and the Michael and Susan Dell Foundation.  With 800+ employees, we are an agile and fast-paced global startup with growing revenues and hands-on leadership.

About the Role

As a Sales Engineer, you are working closely with the Sales team’s efforts to engage with prospective clients and translate their often custom requirements into a full-fledged end-to-end data processing solution.

In order to establish new processes, you will be working with the Sales team, prospective and current clients, and the India-based Project Delivery team. You will also have the opportunity to design, coordinate, and product manage in-house development of custom tools, platforms, and workflows.

This is a role for self-directed learners, creative thinkers, and workplace chameleons. You will need to be adaptive, curious and resourceful and enjoy working with a diverse young team.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with customers and prospective customers to deeply understand their proposed use case(s) and propose solutions based on iMerit’s core offerings, technology, and workforce capability
  • Lead newly engaged customers through any technical sales consultation and project implementation phase, while building trust in the solutions offered by iMerit
  • Work as the bridge between Sales, guiding their understanding of project implementation, and Project Delivery (responsible for actually delivering quality work). This requires a strong ability to multi-task, and switch gears between teams with competing priorities.
  • Provide consultative proposals and findings to clients in an organized and accessible manner. This includes a combination of data analysis, development of workflow proposals, and the ability to clearly map out process and values provided by the iMerit team. While heavily consultative, the ability to win (and maintain) client trust is of great importance.
  • Manage multiple projects simultaneously, including the project design, development, implementation, and delivery

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Minimum 3 years experience and success working in a customer-facing role
  • Prior experience managing a variety of projects and accounts, at different stages of development
  • Ability to work interculturally and in a distributed team
  • Interest (and openness) to travel (India and California)
  • Self-directed learner and hands-on problem solver
  • Comfortable working with numbers and data
  • Prior experience in Account Management, Project Management, Customer Success or Pre-Sales Consultation
  • Desire to learn independently about market trends, technology, and concepts in Machine Learning/Data Science field

Ideal Candidate Traits/Experience:

  • Experience working for an international company
  • Experience working with remote teams
  • Experience working in/with India
  • Prior work history with crowd-sourcing/outsourcing
  • Moderate to advanced Excel knowledge
  • Basic knowledge of SQL and other databases
  • Interest in social impact
  • Basic familiarity with programming languages such as HTML, PHP, Python, R
  • Based in San Francisco Bay Area a plus (Remote OK)

Location: United States

items.title: Sales Specialist @ Pressable
items.content:
Sales Specialist @ Pressable

2017-11-13 16:11

Description

Pressable, a leading provider of WordPress hosting, is looking for driven individuals to join our remote team as a Sales Specialist. This is an outbound sales position. Compensation is salary plus commission. In addition to strong technical sales skills, you’ll need a working knowledge of WordPress to succeed in this role.

Requirements for this role include:

  • Identifying leads using technographic data and other means.
  • Building a pipeline.
  • Travelling to industry events.
  • Being a thought leader, sharing opinions based on customer feedback with our team.
  • Coordinating with team members and leads to get estimates.
  • Working with an Account Manager to ensure that customers are successful and stay with Pressable.
  • Reporting to management and executives on a regular basis.

An Sales Specialist should have the following skills and experiences:

  • Familiar with WordPress and the WordPress Community.
  • Demonstrable success in B2B technical sales. Non-technical salespersons should not apply.
  • A self-starting approach to work.
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, possessing the ability to clearly communicate through text-based chat, video conferencing and phone calls.

Preference will be shown to candidates with experience selling WordPress at a hosting company or digital agency.

We may invite an applicant to complete a limited-time “trial” project as part of the hiring process. A trial is an opportunity for our team to get hands-on experience working with an applicant and evaluating their work. items.title: Sales Manager
items.content:
Kickdynamic is changing the way that brands personalize email marketing content.

96% of marketers know that personalization in email works, but only 6% are actually doing it regularly. Kickdynamic allows brands to personalize email content quickly and easily - increasing conversion and revenue, and saving massive amounts of time and resource.

We work with over 100 brands globally including ASOS, TopShop, MatchesFashion, ASDA, Staples, IHG, Red Bull and with over 100,000 online brands globally - the market opportunity is huge.
We are looking for the best sales talent to take advantage of this opportunity and be part of a growing marketing tech company with ambition to be the market leader and expand globally.

*What you will do:*

* Manage multiple prospects through a clearly defined sales process from lead through to close
* Identifying relevant accounts, prospecting, qualification, demo, negotiation, objection handling and closing; all against a contracted revenue £ target
* You will be comfortable setting up and running 1-2-1 demos of the Kickdynamic platform
* You will be comfortable working with multiple stakeholders within a business from CMO, CRM manager and email designer, to build the right solution to help them all win.
* Outbound prospecting is key method to building pipeline, you must be comfortable picking up the phone and calling prospects
* You will enjoy the challenge of identifying relevant companies and managing an outbound prospecting process to build your own pipeline through a combination of outbound calls and tactical email
* Listen and understand a prospective customer’s challenges, pains and needs, and match those to the Kickdynamic Platform
* You understand the critical importance of building strong and clear pipeline. We have a clear pipeline process and you will need to have a clear understand of each deal so we can move it through the pipeline and be accountable for forecasting
* Seek feedback at every opportunity from leaders, peers and clients to continuously improve

*How you will be successful:*

* Prior sales success - You have a provable track record of sales success against a £ contracted revenue target. This track record could be within a software sales environment, but prior success in another target focused role is also highly relevant e.g recruitment, ad sales. Success in a high volume sales environment would be an additional plus
* Curiosity - You are naturally curious and enjoy the process of learning about a business's unique challenges and objectives and realize that matching those needs to a solution is what delivers sales success
* Ambition - You have big goals and a strong desire to be successful. You get shit done, You are self sufficient in doing so, and you realize that hitting those big goals requires the day to day consistent commitment

*What we offer:*

* We are a small but quick growing company, so you will have the opportunity to make your mark
* An exciting, dynamic and flexible work environment with option to work remotely, and travel to US, EU
* Competitive salary and excellent commission structure with no cap on target
* We are based in We Work with the best view of London, so free beer taps every day after 4pm!
* An ambitious, can do environment - You will be part of a company that has big goals, a strong will to win and a believe that we are on the path to building a market defining company

*How to Apply:*

Send an email directly to me
Tell me about yourself Include links or describe your previous work, or previous projects, or customers.

items.title: Modern Tribe: Business Development Consultant
items.content:
Full-time

(Remote)

The Opportunity

Modern Tribe is looking for a seasoned business development consultant person to join our growing team. This position at Modern Tribe will help the company identify leads and close deals in line with our company values. The ideal candidate for this role is someone who has been closing deals and maintaining key relationships for a successful digital agency for 2+ years and has been technically involved in online projects for 5+ years. You’ve been running projects for ages: you’ve done your own sales, have a proven track record writing proposals, know how to work with WordPress, and understand the nuances of the WordPress business world. You’ve sold projects in the $100k – $1 million+ range, and are looking to go bigger. Above all else, your daily attitude + output embody Modern Tribe’s company ethos of “live well and do good work”: you thrive on keeping the team happy and healthy. Matchmaking — not hitting sales numbers — is your jam. You hustle hard, enjoy the game and relish a genuine success. We pride ourselves on solving real problems for people rather than clutter the interwebs with more shit. If you jive with the mission of setting your team up for success, giving them the right flow and the right kind of projects, even if it means rejecting a potentially-lucrative gig…we’d love to hear from you. Modern Tribe is not interested non-technical sales candidates at this time.

Who We Are

Modern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world’s largest companies, government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a smattering across the globe).

Who You Are

We love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large projects. To be on our team, you must be:

  • HAPPY Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.
  • HELPFUL Always looking for ways that you can help others.
  • CURIOUS It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.
  • ACCOUNTABLE Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of success.

Personal Competencies

  • Impeccable communication + organization skills A deep-seated love for relationship building
  • A diverse background that touches on technology, design and/or strategy, not just sales
  • Self-motivated, detail oriented
  • The ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
  • An engaging + compelling writing style Given the level of client communication involved, a near-perfect command of the English language is required

Knowledge & Experience

  • 2+ years managing sales for digital agencies
  • A strong, proven track record building + managing relationships
  • A strong design or technical background — show us that you’ve been in the mix building stuff!
  • A demonstrable understanding of current technologies and what solutions will/will not work for a given customer’s needs

Bonus Points

  • A strong command of WordPress is HIGHLY desirable, but not required if you have years of experience selling or working with a similar CMS Experience running web design and development projects & managing the customer relationship
  • Experience closing $1 million + in annual sales Proven experience in strategy, design and/or executing major marketing initiatives
  • Distributed team experience is important (but not required)
  • A confidence + love for working remotely, and the potential social isolation that may bring

Responsibilities

Each of Modern Tribe’s team members closes upwards of $1 million in new project work each year. The company provides a healthy pipeline to keep things rolling. Team members are also expected to be out generating leads themselves through speaking at events, blogging, local networking, etc. We don’t do cold calls — we build relationships. The Sales position at Modern Tribe is primarily focused on lead generation and managing the sales funnel through strategic proposals. Specific tasks this will involve include:

  • Managing the inbound inquiry funnel (triage emails, answer calls, etc)
  • Reviewing + qualifying leads that are a good fit for Modern Tribe
  • Helping define + scope projects of all sizes, ranging from $100k to over $1 million++
  • Working directly with service team directors / leads to get estimates
  • Pitching the final project / proposal to the end customer Building relationships with prospective partners
  • Providing regular status updates on daily Sales scrum meetings
  • Working directly with Project Management and Strategy to handoff and oversee confirmed projects / upsell opportunities
  • Ensuring the internal CRM we use for tracking work stays updated + accurate
  • Verifying that that all workflows (proposal templates, estimate templates, etc) are documented and easily accessible
  • Maintaining strong, long-term relationships with customers once the project is underway

Location

Work from anywhere in the US or Canada; if you are in Central or South America, let’s talk. This will be a 100% remote position. If your working hours are in a timezone outside of the US range, but you work 4+ hours of overlap each day our team might be able to consider your application.

Compensation

For this gig we are looking for both full time hires and freelance contract roles of 15-20 hours per week of work. Full time salary between $65,000 – $90,000 USD depending on experience. Keep in mind that Modern Tribe’s sales team does NOT offer commissions at this time.

Perks

We believe that distributed working is a way of life. We understand what it means to work remotely. We offer consistency in expectations, payment, and support. We believe in learning from each other and fostering personal growth. You can expect to learn a lot while working with us. (Also, if you work enough with us, we’ll bring you on the team trips.)

items.title: The Art of Applying: Educational Sales
items.content:
Educational Sales

Posted Oct 31

The Art of Applying
Headquarters: Austin, TX
http://theartofapplying.com/sales

Want to work remotely in a fun, fulfilling, and challenging role for a company that helps high-potential college students and working professionals gain admission to their dream schools and scholarships?

Want to earn $5000+ per month and speak to ambitious dreamers and future leaders from all over the world every day?

As one of my Breakthrough Coaches, YOU would be the person on our team that the prospective client would speak to first. Your job would be to listen to the person’s story—both personal and professional, ask them lots of questions to understand their strengths, weaknesses, and worries (we’ll give you the questions to ask), and then address their doubts and fears one by one about moving forward.

I’m looking for a passionate, persuasive, committed person who can speak to these eager and excited prospective clients and help me decide if the client is a great fit for our program as well as help the right people commit to working with us on their grad school applications.

Apply to join our team if you have these qualities:

  • You are available to work full time Monday – Friday from 9 am - 6 pm Central Time.
  • You are able to attend our daily (Monday – Friday) 1-hour sales team motivation and mentorship meeting at 9 am CST.
  • You value education. You do not need to have a college degree from a prestigious school nor a graduate degree for this position, but you cannot be a person who thinks that college or grad school is a waste of time.
  • You are a positive person. You know how to find the good in adverse situations. Hearing “no” or “I need to think about it” several times a day can be discouraging, and you need to be able to bounce back from rejection and bring your full self to the next call.
  • You are a person who follows through on her commitments. You don’t jump ship or give up when things get hard.
  • You like speaking on the phone. You know how to connect and communicate well with people you cannot see face-to-face.
  • You like people. You do not have to be an extrovert for this position, but you must like speaking with people (on a 1-on-1 basis), connecting with people, and helping people.
  • You are detail-oriented. You will be making 3-5 90-minute Breakthrough phone calls every single work day. Each call will be with a different person with their own particular story, triumphs, and challenges, but there will be a SCRIPT and a METHOD that you must stick to for EVERY SINGLE CALL.
  • You are an honest person with high integrity. You must be willing to turn people away who are not a good fit for our program, even it means that you won’t get a commission for that sale. Making sure we work with the right people (and not just with anyone) has to be more important to you than making as much money as possible.
  • You have consistent access to reliable internet. Our team is primarily remote, so you’ll need your own laptop and reliable internet connection.


How to apply:


STEP ONE: Fill out the application at this link: http://theartofapplying.com/sales

STEP TWO: Take the DISC at this link and submit your results via the form.


About the person hiring for this role:

I’m Kaneisha Grayson, and I’m the founder of The Art of Applying. My team and I help people from around the world apply to the world’s top graduate schools to study business, public policy, law, urban planning, public health, education, and design. Since 2010, we have helped our clients win over $9 million in merit scholarships.

Apply for this position

Submit your application to http://theartofapplying.com/sales

items.title: Sales Assistant
items.content:
US Based Applicants Only. Not hiring in Washington state, Oregon state, San Francisco, or New York.


Simply put, we make websites easier to use. Through a scientific method of determining which site improvements result in actual performance improvements, we replace the old way of designing sites through gut feel and management opinions with designing sites through data. Tactically speaking, clients come to us for both strategic direction and to supplement their internal teams.


We struggled with what to call this job since while the core of the job is sales assistant, the job will also be what you make of it. We refer to our current sales assistant, Jill Mendoza, as our “Jill of all trades” and she has a small picture of Wonder Woman as the :jill: emoji in our slack instance. Unfortunately, we have grown too big for Jill to be able to do everything, so we need more help.


Here are a few of the many, diverse tasks that you'll be potentially doing:

  • Working to make sure quarterly client reviews are on track, and scheduling them with the clients
  • Creating sales decks with our CEO and 2 VPs of business development
  • Creating proposals with our CEO and 2 VPs of business development
  • Ensuring contracts are signed by all parties and facilitating handoffs between business development and the product management team
  • Various marketing tasks such as updating the website, sending out newsletters, posting jobs for sales assistants, etc (how meta!)
  • Helping to arrange team travel and client dinners
  • Competitive research and general LinkedIn research



    Our most successful candidates have the following skills/experience/traits:


  • Ability to get things done with little direction
  • Worked cross-functionally in a highly collaborative environment, preferably in a remote capacity
  • Genuinely like working with clients and their distributed stakeholder group
  • Lifelong learner

    If you’re interested in checking out the swell people you’ll be working with, click here to learn more about the team.

    If you have questions as you go through this, make notes and if we haven’t answered them by the end, feel free to email chris@crometrics.com or tom@crometrics.com.


  • We’re a remote company. We are spread out all over the country and enjoy the flexibility remote working affords. Want to go on a mountain bike ride in the middle of the day? Cool, don’t forget your helmet! Need to pick the kids up from school? Nice, you’ve got parent of the year in the bag. We stay connected through Slack and workcations, including one annual trip that is funded by the company.
  • Our engineers value elegant code, but move fast. We’re writing code that runs on top of existing websites. Some tests only run for a few days before disappearing (though some do so well they become a permanent part of the client’s site). If “minimum viable product” isn’t in your lexicon, you aren’t a good fit.
  • Communication is critical. We’re a remote company. That makes communication — including writing and reading comprehension — extremely important. You’ll work closely with engineers, designers and writers. This is not a simple “write specs and close tickets” gig. Successful applicants enjoy the process of defining and clarifying specs, documenting processes, improving processes, seeing their ideas and work affect millions of users, and uploading custom emoji to Slack.
  • We’re relentlessly focused on our client’s happiness. The PM is a client-facing role. Managing a client relationship virtually takes a different type of skill set – the PMs have to be both a strategic partner, the customer (represented by the data), teacher and project manager over the phone/email/Slack, all while delivering an exceptional level of service. This type of interaction is not for everyone, and we completely understand. It’s not easy!
  • We are not perfect. At the core of experimentation is the lesson to be learned from the test, whether a win, loss or inconclusive. We extend this concept to everything we do by setting the bar high for our team and fostering an environment of radical candor and constant learning.

    This short essay sums up the philosophy we operate by: This is Professionalism: http://arches.io/2014/03/this-is-professionalism/ Sound like something you are interested in? Read on.

Summary

We are looking for a motivated and high-achieving individual based in Europe to join the team working on expansion of the company in global markets. This is a full time placement with significant opportunities for growth, travel and advancement as one of the first employees of the company.

The Company

causaLens is high-tech startup based in London. We are bringing machine learning and big data technologies to the World’s leading asset managers. We are an extraordinary team and the founders have worked for some of the most prominent global hedge funds and scientific institutions.

items.title: IT Business Management (ITBM) Practitioner - ServiceNow - Remote
items.content:
IT Business Management (ITBM) Practitioner
ServiceNow -Remote
Location(s): Remote

ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.
We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.
The IT Business Management (ITBM) Practitioner will be responsible for defining, designing, and overseeing the implementation of ITBM solutions for clients.

What you get to do in this role:
Subject Matter Expert on the ITBM Best Practices
Contribute to the thought leadership of the Project and Portfolio Management Communities of Excellence, as an example

Develop and utilize deep platform knowledge and expertise in:
Workflow Configuration
Application UI Configuration
Development of client specific reporting and integration requirements
Be accountable to ensure Practice deliverables to GEO Customer Delivery and customers are complete, consistent, of high quality, on time and deliver benefits
Contribute to the continual improvement of Global Delivery and Practice business processes as well as the maturing of the IT Business Management portfolio, capabilities, expertise, best practices and solutions
Coaching and mentoring of others and responsible for their career development, education and certification commensurate with the requirements of the practice strategy
Domestic and International travel required up to 50%
In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:
Bachelor degree in Computer Engineering, Information Systems Management or equivalent technical / business qualification through 5+ experience

Desired certifications include:
ServiceNow Administrator
ITIL v3 Foundation and/or Advanced ITIL Certifications
SCRUM, Agile, and/or Scaled Agile
CAPM or Prince2 Certification
1-3 years of experience in working with Enterprise IT software (e.g. ServiceNow, Salesforce, PeopleSoft)
1-3 years of experience in Java, Java Script and corresponding frameworks, like jQuery, Prototype JS or Angular
1-3 years of experience working within Agile or Scaled Agile frameworks
Solid experience in requirements gathering, including experience in creating process documentation
Strong interpersonal skills, customer centric attitude, ability to deal with cultural diversity
We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

items.title: Sales Engineer Open Source @ Wallaroo Labs
items.content:
Sales Engineer Open Source @ Wallaroo Labs

2017-10-23 03:07

Description

Wallaroo Labs is working on a huge idea, and this is a phenomenal opportunity for a person who enjoys challenges. We believe in open source and strive to build on these technologies. Our distributed team is ten people and growing. We had have generated a lot of interest through our product and vision and raised a large seed round with several well-known VCs.

Faster data, more data sources, and business requirements are driving increasingly sophisticated algorithms and putting more and more demands on data applications. Wallaroo Labs solves these problems with Wallaroo, a data engine for building highly elastic big data applications.

We are looking for a Sales Engineer to drive the adoption of Wallaroo open-source offering within the developer community. This position is essential to our success; you will be responsible for identifying friction points with Wallaroo and systematically eliminate to improve the developer experience.

Although Wallaroo's headquarters is in New York, this position can be remote. Candidates located in a Tech Hub cities or that have deep connections within existing developer networks would prove invaluable in building our community.

Responsibilities

  • Provide support to sales team by running demos via remote session
  • Monitor communication channels (HN, Reddit, StackOverflow, Mailing lists, IRC) and interact with the community, answer questions and assist developers.
  • Identify and build relationships with the developer community, meetups, and conferences and leverage relationships to evangelize Wallaroo.
  • Own problem resolution and participate with the development team to create solutions.
  • Publish content from blog posts to video demos.

Qualities we are looking for

  • Experience working on a commercialized open source project (Spark, Cassandra, MongoDB etc.)
  • Ability to learn new technologies quickly.
  • Comfortable with a variety of programming languages, experience with Python, Go, JavaScript are a plus.
  • Familiar with Big Data technologies.
  • Desire and ability to work with enterprise clients and our open source community.
  • Experience working with open source software, GitHub etc.
  • Familiar with software development process in a business setting.
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.

Learn more about Wallaroo

  • Corporate site: http://www.wallaroolabs.com
  • Wallaroo Community Site: http://www.wallaroolabs.com/community
  • Wallaroo Blog: https://blog.wallaroolabs.com/
  • GitHub: https://github.com/WallarooLabs/wallaroo

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Remote Year: Sales Trainer
items.content:
Sales Trainer

Posted Oct 23

Remote Year
Headquarters: Worldwide
https://remote-year.breezy.hr/p/a55eb89b6038-sales-trainer?source=remoteyear

Remote Year

Remote Year brings together communities of interesting professionals, entrepreneurs, and freelancers from across the globe to spend a year working, traveling, and exploring 12 cities around the world. Spending one month in each location, communities connect with local cultures and business ecosystems, forming lifelong, borderless personal and professional relationships along the way. Together we will shape the future of work.

Role Description

We’re looking for an experienced Sales Trainer to educate and train our growing sales team ensuring our reps have the knowledge of the Remote Year product, systems, and processes. Working closely with our Director of Sales Operations, Head of Admissions and Head of Sales, our Sales Trainer will be responsible for executing on the Remote Year sales effectiveness strategy. You will bring your expertise in creating our sales onboarding training and ongoing curriculum for our entire salesforce - touching B2B and B2C Reps, Account Executives, and Customer Success Executives. The Sales Trainer will also be responsible for designing and conducting monthly classes with programs designed to ramp up new sales hires and dedicate specific tracks for each sales team. You’ll be a true sales coach with a passion for process and helping others thrive in an autonomous workplace. You'll drive the statregy towards developing and mentor a team of smart, talented, and passionate sales representatives.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop a deep understanding of our sales organizations procedures, practices, processes, products, systems, technology, and culture to incorporate into training initiatives for each and every salesperson at Remote Year.
  • Sales Training - build out a curriculum of formal and informal training sessions covering new hire sales training, product launches, sales skills training, ongoing skill development, sales boot-camps, internal process updates, etc.
  • Sales Methodology & Onboarding - after learning the sales methodology yourself, build an effective onboarding and ongoing training program to ensure the continuous development of our sales force.
  • Gather metrics and analyze data to assess sales organization-wide developmental needs to drive & support proactive training initiatives.
  • Actively search, creatively design and implement effective methods to educate, enhance performance and recognize performance.
  • Prioritizes coaching and performance management efforts to have the greatest overall impact on the business.
  • Identifies deficiencies in skills among sales associates, and work with Management teams to improve individual's capabilities through coaching, development, and training.
  • Builds peer support and strong internal-company relationships with other key management personnel.

Required Qualifications:

  • Minimum 1-3 years building sales training and curriculum programs from scratch, particularly for distributed sales teams.
  • Previous Leadership experience aligning with the business to identify emerging training needs (re: sales process and/or technical); designing and implement effective learning programs, often working with senior stakeholders.
  • Strong presentation and project management skills.
  • Solid understanding of learning tools and platforms, salesforce, project management and sales content creation.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Able to perform at a high level, in a fast pace, start-up work environment.
  • Outstanding analytical, problem-solving, organization, prioritization and multitasking skills.
  • A flawless record of personal and professional integrity.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in Business, Communications, or Marketing.
  • Experience with fully distributed workforce.
  • Experience in an inbound sales environment.
  • Experience with experience product sales.
  • Experience with consultative sales approach.
  • Knowledge of Sandler Sales Methodology.

    Apply for this position

    Submit your resume and drop us a note explaining what excites you about the role and joining the Remote Year team. We love cover letters and read each and every one.

Job Description

Looking for a high energy, entrepreneurial person who can lead our Global Sales and Marketing efforts, focusing first on the West Coast, then growing in North America through b2b and b2c channels, and finally powering our brand further internationally.

The Global VP of Sales and Marketing would be instrumental in leading our b2b and b2c strategies, implementing the initiatives and growing into a leader of our sales and marketing organization.

The ideal candidate would be able to manage a "starter" online store/ecommerce, pursue fine boutique buyer leads, manage current and future customer accounts and improve our online footprint through social posts, PR initiatives and community management.

We currently have retailers in New York, Shanghai, Kuwait City, Tel Aviv, Guatemala City, Lima, Miami and Houston. The right candidate would be able to leverage our success to capture the attention of high end boutiques in the West Coast to expand our line.

Prior experience marketing or selling aspirational or luxury brands in b2b settings a plus. Fluent english a must, some Spanish greatly appreciated. Availability to travel in the USA and Internationally.

items.title: Inside Sales Representative
items.content:
Inside Sales Representative at FranchiseBlast

Ottawa, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$35K–$100K
No Equity

Job Description

We are looking for someone who can make a significant impact at FranchiseBlast in an inside sales / business development role. We are demanding, but we are rewarding. We are at an inflection point in our company’s history and we would like to see the selected candidate advance in their role to become one of the core pillars of the company.

We offer a flexible work environment. Here are the required skills:
• Good listening skills and empathy
• Excellent understanding of the various business operations (legal, sales, accounting) to see things from the franchisor’s perspective.
• Very comfortable with technology – ability to adapt to the technological level of the interlocutor and provide simple explanations
• Be very confident without falling into arrogance
• Possess previous experience in selling software solutions (in a startup environment)
• Detail-oriented; be able to mention what the two founders of the company studied in university in their motivation letter
• Ability to self-motivate, plan and manage time, develop your own working structures and seek to improve procedures on an ongoing basis
• Ambitious and demanding, determined to succeed and willing to move forward in a changing environment
• Creative : Able to recognize a need and find the best way to fill it
• Excellent written and spoken English, ideally bilingual (French)
• Having the audacity and flair for identifying opportunities, but also patience and resilience.

Assets
• Experience in business and / or within a franchise
• Self motivated and independent
• University degree, new graduates welcome

Your Mission
• Lead generation, demos and follow-ups
• Develop strategies and apply best practices in sales
• Work with the development team to identify requested features or ways to simplify the product
• Timely report all technical difficulties with the site or customers
• Wear different hats! (Marketing, for example)

items.title: Outside Sales Executive - OrderUp
items.content:
Outside Sales Executive - OrderUp at Groupon

Nashville, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$40K–$60K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

As Outside Sales Executive of OrderUp in Nashville, you will have responsibility for quickly growing the OrderUp business. Your primary goal will be to ensure our Nashville customers have a wide variety of restaurants to order from when they go to OrderUp! You will have direct responsibility for signing and on-boarding restaurants on to the OrderUp platform. If you’re up for the challenge of significantly changing the way food is ordered and delivered, we want to hear from you!

- Meet with local restaurants and sell them on working with OrderUp
- Build and maintain relationships with local restaurant partners
- Identify unique sales and marketing opportunities

REQUIREMENTS

- 2+ years of sales experience.
- Local sales experience, especially in the restaurant industry, is helpful.
- Entrepreneurial DNA and strong local networking ability.
- Self-motivated, efficient, humble, and reliable. You act as an owner, not a renter.
- You thrive on flawless execution.
- The details matter to you and anything less than perfection bothers you.
